data.name: Glad Nvmb3R By H4d3s - cod34bl3
data.description:
The glad number of N is the difference between the number of divisors of N-1 and N, but if this difference is 0 or less than 0 it is 0.
When the difference is greater than 0: 
If it is greater than all the glad numbers or equal ,then the glad number is the difference, but if not, it is the greatest.

```javascript
number = 1  d = 1 glad_number = 0
number = 2  d = 2 glad_number = 0
number = 3  d = 2 glad_number = 0
number = 4  d = 3 glad_number = 0
number = 5  d = 2 glad_number = 1
number = 6  d = 4 glad_number = 0
number = 7  d = 2 glad_number = 2
number = 8  d = 4 glad_number = 0
number = 9  d = 3 glad_number = 2
number = 10 d = 4 glad_number = 0
number = 11 d = 2 glad_number = 2
number = 12 d = 6 glad_number = 0
number = 13 d = 2 glad_number = 4
```

You have to show:

what is the glad number of N and how many times is it repeated?

For Example
```javascript
glad_numbers(9) = [2,2]
glad_numbers(13) = [4,1]
```
